A New Collection Launches with the Release of the Medieval Legends Series
11:32,
5/19/2021
There’s an exciting new opportunity available to collectors as JM Bullion introduces the silver and copper rounds of the new Medieval Legends Series. This new 7-round series features distinctive designs on the obverse with a common reverse element that appears throughout the series. The Medieval Legends Series will present designs that capture the image of famous folk heroes from the Medieval Era in Europe. The figure chosen to launch the series is arguably one of the best known: Robin Hood. Learn all about the launch of this new series in our weekly blog post.
Options in the Medieval Legends Series
The Medieval Legends Series is slated to offer seven designs in total, with each of the figures presented on two different round options. These high-quality, beautifully crafted rounds will include a 1 oz silver round option and a 1 oz copper round option. With the launch of this new series, the 1 oz Medieval Legends Robin Hood Silver Round and 1 oz Medieval Legends Robin Hood Copper Round are now available online from JM Bullion.
Robin Hood Obverse
On the obverse side of Medieval Legends Robin Hood Rounds, you will find a depiction of the famed archer of Sherwood Forest. Together with his band of merry men, Robin Hood roams Sherwood Forest dodging the forces of the crooked Sheriff of Nottingham and the evil Prince John. Using his exceptional archery skills, he robs local tax collectors to give back the hard-earned money of England’s poorest people lest it be wasted on the excesses of the Crown and the wealthy landowners. The design shows Robin Hood amidst the foliage of the forest as he draws back an arrow in his bow and takes aim.
Medieval Castle Reverse
The reverse field of the 1 oz Medieval Legends Robin Hood Rounds features a common design element you will find throughout this series. This humble setting captures a glance inside the room of a Medieval Castle. The stone walls of the room are accented by a stained glass window in the background. The table in the foreground has an apple, chalice, ink well, quill, and parchment, all the items one needs to get to work writing down the exploits of a legendary figure like Robin Hood.
History of Robin Hood
The life and times of Robin Hood are set in the early Medieval Era. There are many variations on the story of Robin Hood, but some of the key tenets of his story have remained largely the same over the centuries. Robin is a skilled warrior and is very good with a bow and arrow. He is said to be an outlaw of sorts who lives in Sherwood Forest. His work is honorable and noble, though he is branded as an outlaw because he is fighting to defend the more at-risk people in England from the excessive taxation and cruelty of an unjust king and crooked local tax collectors.
Special JM Bullion Packaging Option
As you start your Medieval Legends Series collection with the Robin Hood Round, now is the perfect time to make sure you get the best possible accessory to house your rounds. The JM Bullion Medieval Legends Series 14-Piece Collector’s Box is ideal for storing your Robin Hood Rounds and all subsequent designs. There is an inset space within the box for 14 individual rounds, one for each design in the collection in both silver and copper. The lid of the box features the JM Bullion logo and there is an outer sleeve for the box that looks like a Medieval scroll. It even has the name of the series printed on it!
Start Your Medieval Collection with the Robin Hood Release
Now is your chance to start an exciting new collection! If you have any questions about this new series, please feel free to ask. JM Bullion customer service is available at 800-276-6508, online using our live chat, and via our email address. We encourage you to follow us on Facebook and read our weekly blog posts for up-to-date information on new releases.
